channel.title: World
channel.description: The Washington Post World section provides information and analysis of breaking world news stories. In addition to our world news and video, Post World News offers discussions and blogs on major international news and economic issues.

item.title: Russia says U.S. adding ‘fuel to the fire’ by letting Ukraine use ATACMS
item.dc:creator: Mary Ilyushina, Francesca Ebel, Natalia Abbakumova
item.description: Vladimir Putin has warned that allowing U.S. weapons to strike inside Russia would make the United States a direct party to the conflict.

item.title: Pope calls for investigation on whether genocide is taking place in Gaza
item.dc:creator: Anthony Faiola, Niha Masih
item.description: While Pope Francis has criticized the war before, this is the first time he has publicly suggested an investigation, according to excerpts from a new book.

item.title: Israeli airstrike on central Beirut kills senior Hezbollah official
item.dc:creator: Suzan Haidamous, Rebecca Tan, Mohamad El Chamaa

item.title: Top Hezbollah spokesman killed; Israeli attack kills 70 in north Gaza, official says
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Tan, Jennifer Hassan, Suzan Haidamous
item.description: Mohammad Afif was killed in an Israeli airstrike on Ras al-Nabaa, a heavily populated part of central Beirut, Hezbollah-aligned media said.

item.title: Russia launches more than 200 missiles and drones at Ukraine
item.dc:creator: Siobhán O'Grady
item.description: The attack damaged energy infrastructure and killed at least two people just ahead of the 1,000-day mark since Russia’s full-scale invasion of Ukraine.

item.title: Venezuela releases 225 political prisoners from post-election sweep
item.dc:creator: Samantha Schmidt
item.description: It was the first major release of dissidents since the start of President Nicolás Maduro’s crackdown, which advocates say has been the worst in the country’s recent history.

item.title: Pope says Israeli attacks in Gaza should be investigated for genocide
item.dc:creator: Anthony Faiola

item.title: Biden approves Ukraine’s use of long-range U.S. weapons inside Russia, reversing policy
item.dc:creator: Ellen Nakashima, Michael Birnbaum, John Hudson, Alex Horton
item.description: The Biden administration will allow Kyiv “limited” use of the ATACMS long-range missile system to strike enemy positions in Kursk, a significant reversal of U.S. policy.

item.title: Israel to issue conscription notices to ultra-Orthodox community
item.dc:creator: Shira Rubin, Lior Soroka

item.title: At least 70 killed in Israeli airstrike in Beit Lahia, official says
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Tan, Jennifer Hassan, Miriam Berger, Hazem Balousha

item.title: Iran hawks will hold less sway in Trump’s new government
item.dc:creator: Abigail Hauslohner
item.description: Republicans are split over how aggressive the next Trump administration should be toward Tehran as the president-elect pursues an America-first foreign policy.

item.title: The struggle against climate change is foundering. Enter Trump.
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: Even before Donald Trump’s election, global climate action faced challenges.

item.title: Lebanon reviews cease-fire proposal as Israel launches fresh strikes
item.dc:creator: Adela Suliman, Victoria Bisset, Abbie Cheeseman, Sammy Westfall
item.description: Fresh Israeli strikes hit Beirut’s southern suburbs Saturday. Lebanon is expected to respond to a U.S.-backed ceasefire proposal soon.

item.title: Iran’s defense minister arrives in Damascus to meet Syrian officials
item.dc:creator: Sammy Westfall, Susannah George, Abbie Cheeseman, Sammy Westfall, Suzan Haidamous

item.title: IDF continues attacks on southern Lebanon
item.dc:creator: Sammy Westfall
